result.execSummary:
The defendant Bruce E Sartin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharge.
Defendant ordered to pay DNA SURCHARGE AND all other costs, penalties and surcharges within 9 months of today's date. 
Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bruce E Sartin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bruce E Sartin in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Bruce E Sartin in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by counsel and defendant.

The court ordered defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 82 days time served.  

Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharge.
Defendant ordered to pay DNA SURCHARGE AND all other costs, penalties and surcharges within 9 months of today's date. 
Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant remanded into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed,
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
-Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;

Defendant Bruce E Sartin in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for plea and sentencing hearing in Branch 10.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bruce E Sartin in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 9/10/14.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Bruce E Sartin in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Bruce E Sartin in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
